newsitem.title: USA: Document Sciences to repurchase shares.
newsitem.headline: Document Sciences to repurchase shares.

text.p: Document Sciences Corp on Monday said it was authorized the repurchase of up to 350,000 shares of its common stock.

It said the shares would be purchased "from time to time," based on several factors including stock price and general market conditions. Purchases may be made in open market or in privately negotiated transactions.

The company, which provides document automation software, said its decision to buy back the shares was based on its view that the current share price did not represent its true long-term value. It said the buyback would also help offset the dilution to earnings per share caused by the issuance of stock under its employee stock plans.
